attributes.action: Slipper sole performance standard for UK supplied slippers.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Slipper health and safety:- Currently indoor slippers are not regulated with regards sole performance.
I recently had an iccident caused by a lack of traction between my slipper sole & carpet, causing the slipper to uncontrollably slide along the carpet until a painful incident occurred.  

On inspecting slippers for a 'certificate of performance' & none found. I am informed there is no requirement for performance testing & approval of slipper soles.
This is very serious loophole with regards health & safety.
Many elderly UK citizens use slippers, a fall to these citizens would be far more distressing.

Speaking with many I have been surprised at the amount of  interest generated. 
Some have thought the subject humorous, until they thought the issue through & agreed with me. I was assured they would be inspecting the slippers of family members. 

Modern man-made carpet & slipper material may have aggravated the issue of traction, although I must stress I am no expert in this area.

What is required: A 'British Standard' of some sort to assure a purchaser that the slipper sole performs properly in normal use & ask that the prime minister look into this as a matter of urgency.
